info.game_comments:
2004 Power Players Week game 1.
From Washington, D.C.

double_jeopardy_round: YOU SHOULD BE IN A BALLET!

(1, 1).clue: Because of his Hanoverian heritage, American colonists called this monarch "German Georgie" or "Geordie"

(2, 1).clue: Built on 200 acres, this Washington, D.C. train station was once the world's largest

(3, 1).clue: 2 reporters unearth a political scandal that goes all the way to the top in this 1976 film based on a book

(4, 1).clue: On Jan. 31, 1999 this team repeated as Super Bowl champs with John Elway throwing for 336 yards

(5, 1).clue: Do the wild fais-do-do in this state while motoring on Interstate 10 to Baton Rouge or Ponchatoula

(1, 2).clue: Among the more colorful nicknames of this agricultural chemist were "Peanut Man" & "Sweet-Potato Man"

(2, 2).clue: The 120-foot big bat being transported here is now at the Kentucky museum named for this 2-word brand

(3, 2).clue: Jimmy Stewart played Jefferson Smith, the naive & idealistic appointee to the U.S. Senate in this Capra classic

(4, 2).clue: On January 4, 1995 he was sworn in as the first Republican speaker of the house in more than 40 years

(5, 2).clue: It's the only U.S. state named for a French king

(1, 3).clue: This animal phrase meaning "courageous" was Richard I of England's nickname

(2, 3).clue: In 1956 a 12,000-square-mile one of these was seen floating off Antarctica; you might call it titanic

(3, 3).clue: This political satire starred John Travolta as a Southern governor running for president

(4, 3).clue: On Nov. 5, 1996, this GOP candidate joked, "Tomorrow will be the first time in my life I don't have anything to do"

(1, 4).clue: He was the "Father of Texas", but the Indians called him "Big Drunk"

(2, 4).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew)  In 1996 a 505 X 255-foot flag decorated this structure seen here in the West

(3, 4).clue: Frank Langella is the power hungry chief of staff in this film in which Kevin Kline plays a presidential impersonator

(4, 4).clue: In April 1992 riots broke out in L.A. after a jury failed to convict the policemen involved in the beating of this man

(1, 5).clue: This 19th century American politician & orator was nicknamed "The Little Giant"

(2, 5).clue: Lady Hamilton could tell you the name of this 185-foot column that went up in the early 1840s

(3, 5).clue: Michael Douglas played Andrew Shepherd, the title character of this film, & even he had trouble dating

(4, 5).clue: Queen Elizabeth II & Francois Mitterrand appeared together at the opening of this on May 6, 1994
(4, 5).correct response: the opening of the "Chunnel" (the Channel tunnel)

(2, 1).clue: This man from Mass. is the ranking Democrat of the Senate's Health, Education, Labor & Pensions Committee

(4, 1).clue: This fluffy skirt that you may have to wear was not named for archbishop Desmond

(5, 1).clue: In this largest country, comrades left & right enjoy coulibiac, a pie made with the spinal marrow of the sturgeon

(6, 1).clue: Some think this Irving Berlin song should replace "The Star-Spangled Banner" as the national anthem -- it's easier to sing

(2, 2).clue: This self-made man has the distinction of being the longest serving senator ever from West Virginia

(4, 2).clue: Your allergy to feathers may prevent you from playing Odette, the queen of the swans in this ballet

(5, 2).clue: The Masai people of this African country mix cow blood with milk for a refreshing drink

(6, 2).clue: Politicians often complain about having to make appearances on this "unappetizing poultry" circuit

(2, 3).clue: This Ariz. senator said of Bush's energy plan, "Just one pork barrel project larded onto another"

(4, 3).clue: To star in this 1890 fairy tale ballet, you shouldn't have spindly legs but you will need a spindle

(5, 3).clue: Sanma aisu is fish-flavored ice cream & taco aisu is octopus-flavored ice cream made in this country

(6, 3).clue: There are Blue & White branches of this African river

(2, 4).clue: This Tennessee senator is a practicing physician

(4, 4).clue: Your striking resemblance to Kirk Douglas has convinced us to star you in the ballet about this gladiator

(5, 4).clue: When on this north Atlantic island be sure to try hakarl, a traditional dish of rotten shark

(6, 4).clue: VP Garret Hobart cast the deciding vote against independence for these formerly Spanish Pacific islands

(2, 5).clue: This Vermont senator wrote, "You get 15 Democrats together in a room, and you get 20 opinions"

(4, 5).clue: Your "Romeo and Juliet" will make everyone forget the 1965 triumph of Rudolf Nureyev & this partner

(5, 5).clue: Consisting of a sheep's minced heart, lung & liver, haggis is a specialty of this U.K. country

(6, 5).clue: The website for this Bureau of the Treasury department is www.moneyfactory.com
(6, 5).correct response: the Bureau of Printing and Engraving

(0, 0).clue: If a president is impeached, this official presides over the trial in the Senate
